comment: Definitely get the merlot flavors. It’s unique and tasty.

"0-1.5: Disgusting. Worth only mixing or meeting the drain. 
2: Bad. Drinkable, but majorly flawed 
2.5: Sub-par. OK, but bland or somewhat flawed. 
3: Good. Decent stuff, but I won’t be rushing to buy it 
3.5: Very good. I’d love to keep a bottle around
4: Excellent. I would like to own a case. A go to for me that is worthy of celebrating 
4.5: Incredible.Truly high end, elite level, very noteworthy
5: Sublime. Nearly perfect and an all time favorite
Standard almonds and vanilla in the nose.  Harsh alcohol taste dominating the pallet.  Sweet honey and brown sugar underneath.

Woolly Bourbon 92 proof. Young ish. Whine barrel finish gives it fruity flavor. Can taste the corn. Can smell the young ness. 
7/26/18 Danny’s deck
Aged in 2nd hand wine barrels.  This makes for an interesting flavor profile that isn't like most whiskeys.
Nose of sugar, flowers and grass, sweet opener, oak, caramel rest of the way
Extremely smooth, no burn, elegant, beeswax, honey, dried fruit, can taste the corn
Young. Alcohol. One dimensional: burnt corn/ leather. Thought it would be a “unique” variant of bourbon but kinda too underwhelming. Don’t taste the wine barreling at all
